entry.def: Never means at no time in the past or at no time in the future.

example.ex: I have never lost the weight I put on in my teens...
example.tran: 我十几岁时增加的体重一直没有减下去。

example.ex: Never had he been so free of worry...
example.tran: 他从未如此无忧无虑过。

entry.def: Never means 'not in any circumstances at all'.

example.ex: I would never do anything to hurt him...
example.tran: 我决不会做任何伤害他的事情。

example.ex: Even if you are desperate to get married, never let it show...
example.tran: 即使你想结婚想得发狂，也决不要表现出来。

entry.def: Never ever is an emphatic way of saying 'never'.
entry.tran: 永不，永无，从未(never的强调说法)

example.ex: I never, ever sit around thinking, 'What shall I do next?'...
example.tran: 我从不闲坐着琢磨：“我接下来做什么呢？”

example.ex: He's vowed never ever to talk about anything personal in public, ever again.
example.tran: 他已发誓再也不当众谈论任何个人的事情，永远不。

entry.def: Never is used to refer to the past and means 'not'.

example.tran: 他从没有取得任何成就。

example.ex: He waited until all the luggage was cleared, but Paula's never appeared...
example.tran: 他一直等到所有的行李都拿走了，但始终没看见葆拉的。

entry.def: You say 'never!' to indicate how surprised or shocked you are by something that someone has just said.
You say 'Well, I never' to indicate that you are very surprised about something that you have just seen or found out.
entry.tran: (表示惊讶)我真没看到(或发现、想到)过

example.ex: 'What were you up to there?' — 'I was head of the information department.' — 'Well I never!'
example.tran: “你在那儿干什么？”——“我是信息部的负责人。”——“啊，真没想到!”

entry.def: If you say that something will never do or would never do, you are saying, often humorously, that you think it is not appropriate or not suitable in some way.
entry.tran: (经常为幽默地表示)不好，不行，不合适

example.ex: It would never do to have Henry there in her apartment...
example.tran: 亨利呆在她的公寓里怎么也不合适。

example.ex: I don't think it is an example of bad writing myself, otherwise I'd be agreeing with Leavis, and that would never do.
example.tran: 我本人不认为这是篇糟糕的文章，否则我就和利维斯看法一样了，那可不行。

means.word_mean: 1. not ever; at no time in the past or future;
